intro: Stigmaphyllon haitiense f. lineare, commonly known as the Haitian stigmaphyllon, is a rare plant species native to the Caribbean, particularly Haiti. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
